channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump launches fresh attacks from familiar playbook with tirade on Somali immigrants
item.description: President Trump made racist comments about Somali immigrants and Somalia multiple times this week. It's a common tactic used by the president to get attention from those who share his nativist views.
item.content:encoded: President Trump made racist comments about Somali immigrants and Somalia multiple times this week. It's a common tactic used by the president to get attention from those who share his nativist views.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: 'We refuse to be silent': Somali-Americans unite against Trump's divisive rhetoric
item.description: Somali-Americans in Minnesota say President Donald Trump's racist comments about them and threats of immigration enforcement are stirring up unnecessary fear in their communities.
item.content:encoded: Somali-Americans in Minnesota say President Donald Trump's racist comments about them and threats of immigration enforcement are stirring up unnecessary fear in their communities.
item.dc:creator: Kirsti Marohn

item.title: Rep. Omar says Trump attacks Somali immigrants to 'deflect attention' from scrutiny
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., who came to the U.S. from Somalia, about President Trump's racist tirade against Somali immigrants.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., who came to the U.S. from Somalia, about President Trump's racist tirade against Somali immigrants.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 'New York Times' sues Pentagon over media restrictions
item.description: The Times accuses Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth of violating its constitutional rights with a press policy that, the paper says, deprives the public of access to critical national security information.
item.content:encoded:
The Times accuses Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth of violating its constitutional rights with a press policy that, the paper says, deprives the public of access to critical national security information.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: In an era of rising prices, computers have gotten cheaper. (And why that may end)
item.description: One thing has bucked the trend of rising prices: computing. Technological advances have underpinned a consistent drop in the cost of computers. But experts say that this may be reaching a limit.
item.content:encoded:
One thing has bucked the trend of rising prices: computing. Technological advances have underpinned a consistent drop in the cost of computers. But experts say that this may be reaching a limit.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump continues attacks on Somali immigrants, new report finds defense secretary violated regulations with March Signal group chat, CDC vaccine committee expected to question child vaccine schedule.
item.content:encoded: Trump continues attacks on Somali immigrants, new report finds defense secretary violated regulations with March Signal group chat, CDC vaccine committee expected to question child vaccine schedule.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 'Rosemead' tells the true story of a mother's desperate attempt to protect her son
item.description: NPR's A Martínez speaks with actress Lucy Liu about "Rosemead," a new film based on the true story of an ailing woman who takes drastic measures in an attempt to protect her troubled teenage son.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martínez speaks with actress Lucy Liu about "Rosemead," a new film based on the true story of an ailing woman who takes drastic measures in an attempt to protect her troubled teenage son.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Trump administration begins immigration crackdown in New Orleans
item.description: Federal immigration agents launched an enforcement operation in New Orleans on Wednesday that they say is aimed at criminals who are in the country illegally.
item.content:encoded: Federal immigration agents launched an enforcement operation in New Orleans on Wednesday that they say is aimed at criminals who are in the country illegally.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: White House targets experienced immigration judges in the latest round of firings
item.description: The White House has been firing immigration judges all year. But in the latest round, a lot more experienced judges are being let go, not just those still on probation.
item.content:encoded: The White House has been firing immigration judges all year. But in the latest round, a lot more experienced judges are being let go, not just those still on probation.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Putin to visit India after U.S. imposed tariffs on India for buying Russian oil
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visits India Thursday for the first time since launching the full-scale invasion of Ukraine. It comes after the U.S. imposed tariffs on India for buying Russian oil.
item.content:encoded: Russian President Vladimir Putin visits India Thursday for the first time since launching the full-scale invasion of Ukraine. It comes after the U.S. imposed tariffs on India for buying Russian oil.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
